channel.title: Bayesian on NeuronStar
channel.description: Recent content in Bayesian on NeuronStar

item.title: Conditional Probability and Bayes
item.description: The Bayesian view of probability is quite objective and also more general than the frequentist’s view. It doesn’t rely on repeatition of events.

item.title: Least Squares, Bootstrap, Maximum Likelihood, and Bayesian
item.description: Least squares, bootstrap, maximum likelihood, and maximum posterior leads to the same results in many cases.

item.title: EM Methods
item.description: Topics EM for Gaussian mixtures General EM algorithm Why does it work? Decomposition of log-likelihood into KL divergence and Relation between EM and Gibbs sampling

item.title: Variantional Inference Normalizing Flow
item.description: Topics Variational Inference Normalizing Flow Variational Inference with Normalizing Flows

item.title: Hamilton WL. Graph Representation Learning. Chapter 8
item.description: Our topic for this session is Chapter 8 of Hamilton WL. Graph Representation Learning: Traditional GraphGeneration Approaches. Use the following timezone tool or click on the “Add to Calendar” button on the sidebar. Click here for an interactive widget.

item.title: Inferring causal impact using Bayesian structural time-series models
item.description: Our topic for this session is Inferring causal impact using Bayesian structural time-series models (arXiv:1506.00356). Abstract Abstract of Inferring causal impact using Bayesian structural time-series models (arXiv:1506.00356): An important problem in econometrics and marketing is to infer the causal impact that a designed market intervention has exerted on an outcome metric over time. This paper proposes to infer causal impact on the basis of a diffusion-regression state-space model that predicts the counterfactual market response in a synthetic control that would have occurred had no intervention taken place.

item.title: References for Probability Estimation Club
item.description: A list of references for our online discussions.
